channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Prayers to remember victims
item.description: It comes as a former Met Police chief calls for social media checks for those seeking a gun licence.

item.title: Covid: 16 and 17-year-olds in England to be offered jab by 23 August
item.description: Those in England will be offered a jab or the chance to book one by 23 August, the government says.

item.title: Deaths of police officer and child 'awful' for West Mercia colleagues
item.description: "Heartbreak" over police colleagues' discovery of the bodies of a 39-year-old man and child aged three.

item.title: Hidden cameras spot New Forest pine marten
item.description: A new study aims to discover more about how the rare creatures have bred in the New Forest.

item.title: Manchester United v Leeds: Six arrests made
item.description: Social media footage showed chairs and a bin thrown in a fight in Manchester city centre.

item.title: Cornwall Royal Marines death prompts sea depths checks
item.description: A 20-year-old recruit died after disembarking into deep water at Tregantle in Cornwall.

item.title: Anita Neil: Exhibition on first black British Olympian extended
item.description: Former sprinter Anita Neil says she is "very proud and honoured" to be the focus of the exhibition.

item.title: Who were the victims?
item.description: The gunman's mother, Maxine Davison, and three-year-old Sophie Martyn have been named among the dead.

item.title: A visual guide to what happened
item.description: A gunman shot and killed five people in Plymouth before turning the gun on himself. Here's what we know about how events unfolded.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Starmer asks why gunman had licence
item.description: The police watchdog is investigating the decision to give back Jake Davison's shotgun and certificate.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: 'My brain can't process it'
item.description: Jake Davison shot his 51-year-old mother, Maxine Davison, before killing four others.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: PM Boris Johnson - My thoughts are with the families
item.description: Boris Johnson also says it needs to be "properly investigated" how the gunman got a firearms licence.

item.title: Incels: A new terror threat to the UK?
item.description: Is the incel belief system followed by Jake Davison, the Plymouth gunman, a terror threat to the UK?

item.title: Plymouth Shootings: Home Secretary says many questions to be asked
item.description: Home Secretary Priti Patel says she'll be looking for answers about the shootings that left six dead.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Who can own a firearm or shotgun in the UK?
item.description: A shooting in Plymouth which left six people dead has put the focus on who can own a gun in the UK.

item.title: Shooting 'a truly shocking event' say police
item.description: Devon and Cornwall Police Chief Constable Shaun Sawyer explains how reports of the shootings came in.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Inside the dark world of 'incels'
item.description: Who are the angry young men who describe themselves as "involuntarily celibate"?

item.title: Plymouth MP: Community 'trying to make sense' of shooting
item.description: MP Luke Pollard says the community is pulling together in the face of the "deeply grim" news.

item.title: Drone spots suspected burglars on Mansfield bank roof
item.description: Police found no sign of any intruders until they deployed a thermal imaging drone.

item.title: Boy takes on 150-mile walk from Rugby to visit grandparents
item.description: Fundraising Arthur Mortimer says he is looking forward to his nan's cakes after lockdown kept them apart.

item.title: James Markham killing: Chingford father was partner's 'world'
item.description: The partner of James Markham has remembered him as "her world" following his stabbing.

item.title: Merrivale Model Village owner shares Banksy's tactics
item.description: The secretive artist leaves a spray-painted miniature stable at a model village without anyone seeing.

item.title: Windermere diver retrieves lost prosthetic leg from lake
item.description: Angus Hosking finds Josephine Bridges' leg after responding to a social media plea for help.

item.title: Newcastle exhibition sheds a light on life in lockdown
item.description: Mini sheds are made during lockdown with remote support from artist Nicola Lynch.

item.title: Donald Campbell: Plea for return of restored Bluebird 'in one piece'
item.description: Restorer Bill Smith says a museum has broken an agreement to "share" the restored craft.

item.title: Injured veteran Ben Parkinson queries Afghan sacrifice
item.description: Ben Parkinson and his family question if the Afghanistan sacrifice "was worth it".

item.title: Former Newbury Football Club Faraday Road site destroyed by fire
item.description: West Berkshire Council urged people to stay away from the ground following the blaze.

item.title: Jacksdale woman charged with murder of three-year-old boy
item.description: Police took the boy to hospital after he was hurt at a home in Jacksdale, but he died two days later.

item.title: Car in near-miss with train on Cumbria level crossing
item.description: CCTV footage shows the car driving across the barrierless crossing in front of the Northern train.

item.title: Bolton woman inspired to create Muslim hiking group
item.description: Amira Patel says more women should be encouraged to become confident walking in the wild.

item.title: Bomb threat arrest at Northampton police station caught on film
item.description: A man is seen being tackled to the ground by officers after claiming he had a bomb in a bag.

item.title: Kane, Southgate and Sterling mural in Nuneaton nets Â£10,000
item.description: The three lions on the wall painting in Nuneaton helps to fund seven defibrillators.

item.title: Covid-19 testing 'mega lab' officially opens in Leamington Spa
item.description: The Leamington Spa facility has already processed about 300,000 coronavirus tests.

item.title: 'I saw my baby's heart out of her chest'
item.description: As a children's heart unit in Leicester relocates, parents of sick children tell their stories.

item.title: Railroad to recovery: Trains and trowels put former addicts back on track
item.description: A unique scheme allowing recovering addicts to tend a remote railway station returns.

item.title: Care home deluged with cards for Jack Annall's 101st birthday
item.description: Jack Annall was sent the cards after being disappointed not to see his daughter on his birthday.

item.title: Murder-accused boy, 14, in court over stabbing
item.description: A 14-year-old boy appears in youth court charged with murdering James Markham.

item.title: Esther Dingley: Hiker's Pyrenees death an accident, police say
item.description: Sources say it is unclear what caused her to fall but her boots may have been unsuitable for ice.

item.title: England v India: Joe Root makes masterful century at Lord's
item.description: England captain Joe Root makes his second masterful century in a week, but the second Test is deliciously poised after India rally late on day three.

item.title: Manchester United 5-1 Leeds United: Bruno Fernandes hat-trick earns hosts thumping win
item.description: Bruno Fernandes scores a hat-trick as Manchester United overpower old rivals Leeds to make the perfect start to the new Premier League season.

item.title: 'He's unstoppable' - is there even more to come from masterful Root?
item.description: Pundits lavish praise on England captain Joe Root's "brilliant exhibition" of batting, but Jonny Bairstow says his team-mate can get even better.

item.title: Chelsea 3-0 Crystal Palace: Premier League title contenders cruise against Patrick Vieira's side
item.description: Chelsea underline their Premier League title credentials with a thoroughly comfortable win over Patrick Vieira's Crystal Palace.
